intro: Achnodonton, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and distinctive, milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is found in various regions across North America. Achnodonton produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
